image.altText: a woman sitting on an outdoor couch in a brightly-patterned top next to a brown border collie

props.synopsis: It's a far from uncommon situation. But what can you actually do if the neighbour's dog just won't stop barking?

title.children: How to deal with a neighbour's nuisance barking dog (and keep things cordial)

image.altText: Two police officers walk near the scene of the collision in Kambah.

props.synopsis: A 75-year-old woman has died after a single vehicle crash in Canberra's south.

title.children: Woman dies after single vehicle crash in Canberra parking lot

image.altText: Concept art of a sports club.

props.synopsis: A proposed club from Vikings Group with 160 poker machines has been met with criticism from a community group and anti-gambling advocates in the NSW region.

title.children: Club with 160 poker machines proposed for Jerrabomberra

image.altText: An Australian runner leads a group of runners across the line in her Olympic heat.

props.synopsis: Athletics made the headlines in Australia multiple times in 2024 because the athletes stepped up to another level, catching the attention and the imagination of the nation.

title.children: 2024 a great year for Australian athletics, and all signs point to it getting better

image.altText: A white man runs with a group of Thai children, all are wearing yellow shirts. One kid is high fiving the man.

props.synopsis: After the 2004 Boxing Day tsunami, forensic investigator Peter Baines wanted to create good from the enormity of loss. Twenty years on, he has raised $30 million for children orphaned by the disaster.

title.children: The forensic officer who changed lives after 2004 Boxing Day tsunami

image.altText: a woman sets a table in a restaurant

props.synopsis: Caitlin Baker is an accomplished sommelier, but that doesn't mean she's always treated respectfully by customers or colleagues.

title.children: 'I want to talk to a man': Female hospitality workers call out sexism

image.altText: A man stands in a Christmas tree farm wearing a wide-brim hat.

props.synopsis: For many the trek to the nearest Christmas tree farm to choose a tree is as much a part of the holiday season as Christmas dinner.

title.children: The six-year process to grow the perfect real Christmas tree

image.altText: A boat can be seen almost entirely submerged in a lake, trees lining the bank.

props.synopsis: Police said the passengers were on a cruise around lake when the boat began to take on water.

title.children: Twelve rescued from sinking boat on Canberra's Lake Burley Griffin

image.altText: Australia batter Steve Smith plays a shot at the MCG.

props.synopsis: Sam Konstas's blistering 60 off 65 steals the headlines on day one at the MCG, with Steve Smith still alive in his hunt for his second century of the series.

title.children: Smith makes it through to stumps as debutant Konstas owns Boxing Day

image.altText: Joe Biden in a blue suit shaking hands and smiling with Volodomyr Zelensky wearing an olive green top

props.synopsis: The outgoing US president has ordered weapons deliveries for Kyiv to continue on the same day Russia launched a Christmas missile attack on Ukrainian energy infrastructure.

title.children: Biden directs US to keep giving Ukraine weapons after Russian strikes

image.altText: Two men in khaki army gear smile in a selfie, with one's face blurred.

props.synopsis: Russia's Ministry of Foreign Affairs says Australia had contacted Moscow about the possible capture of an Australian citizen fighting with Ukrainian forces and that it was looking into the matter.

title.children: Russia says it's looking into footage of Australian captured in Ukraine

image.altText: A drone view shows the crash site of an Azerbaijan Airlines passenger plane near the city of Aktau

props.synopsis: Kazakh authorities said 29 people had survived the crash of the Embraer 190 near the city of Aktau, an oil and gas hub on the eastern shore of the Caspian Sea.

title.children: At least 38 people dead after Russia-bound passenger plane crashes in Kazakhstan

image.altText: Two people in beds in an Afghan hospital hooked up to drips.

props.synopsis: Bombardment by Pakistani military aircraft in Afghanistan's eastern Paktika province kills at least 46 people, most of whom are children and women, according to the Taliban.

title.children: Taliban vows retribution after Pakistani air strikes kill 46 people

image.altText: Master Lock Comanche sails

props.synopsis: On a dramatic opening day of the Sydney to Hobart yacht race, Master Lock Comanche is tracking inside the race record while three boats have withdrawn with gale-force winds forecast. Look back at the action.

title.children: Comanche on track to break Sydney to Hobart record as three boats retire — as it happened

image.altText: Garry Kissick holds son Hayden as he and wife Ash Barty pose for a photograph on the beach

props.synopsis: Former world number one Ash Barty has surprised fans by announcing on social media she is expecting her second child with husband Garry Kissick.

title.children: Ash Barty reveals she is expecting second child

image.altText: Coco Au sits on her small bed among her items in her cramped subdivided flat.

props.synopsis: More than 200,000 people in Hong Kong are crammed into tiny subdivided flats but a government plan to build temporary housing worries some residents and advocates.

title.children: In pricey Hong Kong, the city's poorest live in 'cage' and 'coffin homes'

image.altText: King Charles wearing a dark suit jacket, blue tie and white shirt standing in front of a blurred Christmas tree

props.synopsis: King Charles III has delivered his third annual Christmas Day message from the chapel of a former hospital in central London.

title.children: The four key takeaways from King Charles' Christmas Day message

image.altText: A hand full of white tablets

props.synopsis: Authorities reportedly found the cache of pink and yellow Captagon pills in a security compound formerly belonging to ousted president Bashar al-Assad's forces.

title.children: 1 million Captagon pills found in Assad-owned 'security quarter'

image.altText: Bear cub holding red ball in sanctuary

props.synopsis: Zookeepers and volunteers have returned to Sydney from a Laotian bear sanctuary after working with vulnerable cubs rescued from the illegal wildlife trade.

title.children: What life looks like for rescued bear cubs saved from trafficking

image.altText: A composite of six photos of four men and two women

props.synopsis: The Israeli military's actions in southern Gaza had a "circumstantial influence" on a decision by Hamas militants to kill six hostages in August, an IDF report says.

title.children: IDF report reveals Israeli 'influence' on six Hamas hostage killings

image.altText: A white and blue United Airlines Boeing 787-10 Dreamliner plane mid-takeoff above other planes and a brown landscape

props.synopsis: The Boeing 787-10 had flown from Chicago to the Hawaiian island, and the airline says it remains unclear how or when the person accessed the wheel well.

title.children: Body found in wheel well of United Airlines plane in Maui

image.altText: A a silver SUV and police car parked outside a two-story house, which is cordoned off with police tape.

props.synopsis: A man has been charged with murder over the death of a woman in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Man charged with murder of woman in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: A burnt out store

props.synopsis: A manhunt is underway after an alleged firebombing and assault occurred at a Brisbane tobacco store Thursday morning.

title.children: Police hunting for male suspect after Brisbane tobacco store attack

image.altText: A semi-rural road with trees and powerlines

props.synopsis: An off-duty police officer found the body of a young man by a Far North Queensland roadside in the early hours.

title.children: Farm worker granted bail over alleged Christmas Day hit-and-run fatality

props.synopsis: A 28-year-old DJ is charged after police say he refused to shut down what they say was an "out-of-control" party at Port Beach in Fremantle, the second of two such gatherings in the area overnight.

title.children: DJ charged at 'out-of-control' Christmas rave, riot police called in

image.altText: Gi-hun has a crazed, desolate expression in his eyes as he stares at something off-camera while surrounded by other players.

props.synopsis: Here's your Squid Game refresher as the dystopian horror that captured imaginations around the world returns for its penultimate season.

title.children: Time for another round of Red Light, Green Light: Squid Game is back

image.altText: Composite image of multiple film characters, including an evil Sonic the Hedgehog, a singing chimp and Tilda Swinton

props.synopsis: Boxing Day is here, and with that comes a whole slate of amazing new films. We guide you through them, from Oscars favourites to family fun.

title.children: From a Cannes prize winner to a chimp biopic, these films are out December 26

image.altText: Elena Rybakina holds a trophy

props.synopsis: The Australian Open is just around the corner, but before that, the world's top tennis players will sharpen their racquets at a variety of tournaments across Australia. Here's how to keep track of them all.

title.children: How to follow the Australian Summer of Tennis ahead of Aus Open

image.altText: Fakhar Zaman walks with his head down as India celebrates

props.synopsis: England are Australia's first Champions Trophy opponents in Pakistan in February but Pat Cummins' team could end up playing the final in Dubai.

title.children: Australia to meet England in ICC Champions Trophy as India's demands met

image.altText: Joel Embiid, right, argues with referee Jenna Schroeder

props.synopsis: Philadelphia 76ers star Joel Embiid was ejected from his NBA game against the San Antonio Spurs, and reacted angrily towards official Jenna Schroeder.

title.children: Joel Embiid thrown out of NBA game for contact with female official

image.altText: Sweetheart's capture by the rangers in 1979

props.synopsis: Sweetheart the crocodile's notoriety for attacking fishing boats helped put the Northern Territory on the world map in the early '80s. But could another crocodile be behind his legacy?

title.children: Sweetheart is famous for attacking boats, but is another croc to blame?

image.altText: A man, two young girls and a young boy sit on a bench in a shed, all wearing or holding cowboy hats.

props.synopsis: A cowboy hat is a practical means of sun protection, but for many country folk in WA's Gascoyne it also serves as a chronicle of their adventures.

title.children: Cowboy hats become fashion statements as well as family heirlooms

image.altText: Simone Young conducts the Sydney Symphony string section, her left arm extended and her right holds the baton in front of her.

props.synopsis: From Aussies like Simone Young trailblazing on the world stage through to the improvisatory genius of Bill Bailey, 2024 was a great year for music.

title.children: Australian talent shines, wrapping 2024's best classical music stories

image.altText: a child and his parents smile upwards with blue sky behind

props.synopsis: Hours from the mainland and in the middle of the ocean, Ruby Holmes and Heinrich Breuer are raising their son on the Great Barrier Reef.

title.children: Raising a baby on a remote island 'the best thing we ever did'

image.altText: A woman in a wheelchair holding a book with a man crouched down beside her

props.synopsis: Dr Wendy Bourke realised six years ago that she was losing her memory and stepped down from work sooner than she had planned. Her family was amazed by what she had written about her life and helped publish her memoirs.

title.children: Former doctor living with dementia publishes memoirs with family's help
